summary: The National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS) manages fish stocks in federal waters. This includes working to prevent overfishing and giving fish stocks that are overfished a chance to rebuild. NMFS offices submit information on overfishing and overfished stocks to a central database. But this database has some limitations—like not allowing staff to easily analyze trends over multiple years, which can be useful for tracking the...
title: Federal Fisheries Management: Overfishing Determinations Vary Across Regions, and Data Challenges Complicate Management Efforts
